content: Works great and love that it has a MacOS desktop version as well. Just wish you could add folders all at once and not have to create a new folder in the vault then add all of the files. If that ability was added, it'd be perfect for me.

I just switched to Cryptomatornfrom of the competitors, and I must admit I should've done it long time ago. It has everything I need: support for Google Drive, filename encryption, one time payment (no ongoing charges). Being open source is additional bonus!
Great app! It just works! Secure, open source, cross-platform and simple. The best of its kind.
Wow! That's the app, easy, secure, reliable, never failed me in the last four years I've been using! Thx development team!
Pls improve search feature to search in all folders

Great app and I respect their decision to make the mobile version not for free as they want to work on their project. I got a refund as I had an issue to connect to my vault by WebDAV so it maybe wasn't the best solution for me. Anyway Cryptomator are a great and honest team. You can trust them.
Good app but need more desktop features

G8 app must have if using cloud storage . I have been using since one year have no issues.I have 2nd phone with lineage custom rom & Gapps (pico) the only problem there is the biometric dosent work , can it be fixed if possible.

Disabled all apps from drawing over cryptomator and still can't access cryptomator. Maybe this feature should be off by default? Will change to 5 stars once fixed as it's the only major issue I have had over the years and I want to support open source software.

Needs improvement!! Please add ability to see time/dates of stored files instead of "3 years ago". Please have the ability to see LONG files names with a scroll or something. Files that do not fit are hard to determine what they are.
With Cryptomator + Syncthing no need for third-party cloud services. No more limits for the storage and devices attached. Easy to use. Keep up the good work guys!

Well done to the makers. Better than the commercial alternative and at a lower price (instead of annual subscription they charge for their phone apps, and it is 1 time payment - fair enough.) I recommend it. I also vote for 2 features: 1. Thumbnails for photos. 2. To have the option to choose if the original file in the phone gets deleted after being uploaded, just to save space on the phone (including the auto photo upload.) 3. Auto video uploads not only the photos.

Google Shared Drives: Although the PC version works, the Android version does not. After spending days encrypting and uploading all of my material, I am unable to access any of it on my phone. This is a fixable problem and the developers have been aware of it for years (see GitHub).

There is no way to access the SD card on my Xiaomi MIUI phone from this app. Also, no obvious way to open an existing EncFS file. Please, either fix the above, or show me (and others) how to do these things. I am a paid user as of Oct. '19. Edit: there is no way to click on your link or copy it here. Issue still unresolved!
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. This should work using a "Custom location", read more: https://docs.cryptomator.org/en/latest/android/cloud-management/#login-local-storage

content: This app need improvement on accessing to cloud, I.e: if using Google team drive or shared drives, we can use this app to encrypt the contenta inside. Another thing if you try to encrypt and upload multiple files to the cloud, it would likely crash the app.
Great app!
Did not put lock on files
Works as expected and so far flawlessly. Feature request: show folder contents (images and videos) as thumbnails (with selectable size).
Perfect app long time searching such one ...

I hope it is reliable. I found two issues on the smart phone app: 1. When I add a file to a vault, with the share option, the filename is changed to a number instead of keeping the name of the file. This implies that I copy the file name and paste it in the field. I think this could be resolved. 2. After editing a file, eg xls, it will not be saved automatically to the vault. I have to save it in a local folder and thereafter share it to cryptomator. (So this is not like on the computer)
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. From which app are you trying to share the files with Cryptomator? Then we can reproduce it. For the second problem you can find here some background information: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/150

content: Cannot upload files, they stop inbetween while uploading. Couldn't view enough information about uploaded files, Cannot view thumbnails of image files etc. This app isn't all that useful!
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback.
Can you please enable debug mode, upload again a file which fails and send us the log file? https://community.cryptomator.org/t/how-do-i-enable-debug-mode-on-android/66

content: I really like your windows app and bought this for my phone but unfortunately I can't access my files from phone. I used Shared Drive (or used to be called as Team Drive) in Google and that's now showing up when I login to Google Drive via the app. Any clue how I can do that?
Essential for one's privacy, but will the encrypted data also be decrypted with another app if I can't use Cryptomator anymore?
Great app, easy to use. I have been using Cryptomator for several cloud providers without problems on Android, Windows and Linux.

Simple, safe and effective. This app provides zero knowledge cloud encryption. but watchout, for Android online file editing of cloud files you will need a word compatible app like Mobi Officesuit. Word will Not work.

The app keeps forgetting where vaults are stored. It'll list the correct path but I must re-add existing vaults every time to be able to open them. (Working with developer to fix, will update review if issue is handled)
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. Which Cloud do you use? Can you please provide us a step by step guide that we can reproduce the problem? Thanks!

content: Been using for a couple years without issue, but now it is not showing files uploaded via Gdrive and Win10app (v1.5.6). Backup&Sync shows activity when adding file to vault via Win10, but Android app does not show the files or directory. Happens across multiple vaults, even after clearing Android app cache/data/reinstall. EDIT 1: How do I locate the file if the file names/structure are encrypted? Gdrive via web browser Recents tab shows activity some file changes when I upload from Android app.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. I meant just put an unencrypted file in one of the Backup&Sync folders on the PC so we can see that the PC is syncing to the cloud.

content: Would be good if android sharing remembered directory to save directly. And cache size unlimited instead of max 5GB. But apart from that all good.
needs thumbnails

Easy to use... Works with Google drive... Only issue I have, I can't seems to make the search function to work... Auto lock also doesn't work on my OnePlus 6T. 4.16.20 - auto lock is now working for me Auto lock working... But search function still pretty much useless...
Works as expected.
Would be perfect, if access wouldn't be so slow compared to normal Drive app
Very bad upload option. It get canceled during calls and not resuming on its own. Please update and fix this issues.

Gdrive only good in Windows, but if in Linux and Windows, Dropbox is the best with Cryptomator. I don't use both, Nextcloud is better for privacy. Anyway, this app really easy to refund, not that what I want, I just want to try reinstalling this app. :D Jeez, 2020 Google still not making a Gdrive client for Linux. 😑
When adding existing masterkey, this app version gives error "vault not found"
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback.
Can you please enable debug mode, reproduce the problem and send us the log: https://community.cryptomator.org/t/how-do-i-enable-debug-mode-on-android/66

content: Great app but needs to Implement video streaming decoding instead of having to download every file to view. Same with photos.... needs to be like when on desktop
Still doesn't have thumbnails, which makes it difficult to distinguish between files.

Great idea in theory but kind of disappointing in practice and I wish I could get my £9 back. No way to import folder structure; I had to recreate my folder structure from scratch and then import each folder one by one. This might have been bearable but the app either crashes during file import or it imports one or two less files than I actually selected. For example I select 20 files from my local storage to import but it only imports 18. Happens randomly and is very frustrating.

Prefer this to Boxcryptor. Pay once on mobile for lifetime license supporting unlimited clouds, Free desktop app is open source. Version 1.5 has a local cache, making access to secure files much faster. Support built in for google drive, and works with other cloud providers using WebDav. Photo upload and viewer is great for backing up and managing your camera files.
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback. 
Open next picture should work already by sliding from the right to the left when you're in preview mode or do you have something else in mind? 
For deleting files out of the preview mode, I will create an Issue on GitHub for you.

content: Simplifies keeping data encrypted.

Excellent app for encrypting your files stored to the cloud. Much better experience that that it caches and seems to preload files. I have encountered limit to number number pictures you can upload in a batch, with no meaningful error message that would indicate the cause of the problem.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback.
Can you please enable debug mode, reproduce the problem and send us the log? https://community.cryptomator.org/t/how-do-i-enable-debug-mode-on-android/66

content: works great!

Very easy to use. I like it better than a product I paid for (Boxcryptor). Cryptonator encrypts both the file name and the file itself, and you can't see the encrypted file when logged into your cloud accounts. The only way you can view the encrypted files is by logging in through Cryptomator. I'm not worried about a backdoor to this application since it's open source and vetted by so many programmers. Download the app for $8 and be done with it.
Can add a function to automatically sync a local folder any type of files?

I wish I could use the app, but my encrypted vaults on Google Drive's Shared Drives aren't supported (or I can't figure it out). Which is a shame because on Desktop they work perfectly and a competing service (rhymes with foxcryptor) has no issues on mobile either. Please let me know when you've added this functionality and I'll adjust my review accordingly.
It works fine for WebDAV, but SMB("Windows shares") and SFTP("SSH file transfer") are both not supported, sadly. 😔

Use Cryptomator constantly on Windows so I thought I could support the dev while getting the app at the same time. I understand it can be a bit harder to make apps work together in the boxed environment of Android compared to Windows, so for now I'm just content using it as a file viewer and modify anything on PC. Hoping for a more seemless way to edit Microsoft documents in the future. A feature I would love to see on both platform is a fake password entry that would open a decoy vault.
Fingerprint scanner more often than not trigger home button and exits app. Please fix this. Update: I am now using phone with on screen fingerprint sensor and no longer have the problem.
replyContent:
Do you have still the this error?

If yes, could you provide us please a log file: https://community.cryptomator.org/t/how-do-i-enable-debug-mode-on-android/66

content: Good when it works... But if you upload a good share of photos (circa 500 files), you often get interrupted during the uploading with a nice informative message "An error occurred". Then you have to lock the vault, unlock again, navigate to the destination folder, and start the upload again... and again... and again...

It works like a charm. I really wanted an app to encrypt my cloud that allows me access to my files. It would be awesome if the text editor was markdown capable or if it was possible to use external apps without copying files outside of the vault.
Great app! Please add support for Mega. 😁
Well done!!!

Very good app. However, there are some issues when updating to version 1.5.1. Usee of dropbox does no longer work in 1.5.1. Endless loop when trying to authorize access to dropbox. Access to to onedrive still works in 1.5.1
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback.
Can you please enable debug mode, reproduce the problem and send us the log file? https://community.cryptomator.org/t/how-do-i-enable-debug-mode-on-android/66

content: App has improved significantly but still has a ways to go. I fully support the developers, but its surprising how much they charge for an app that is so bare bones...and should be beta based on the features available on a paid app. Can't use multiple vaults from a single provider (desktop can)...seems like VERY basic functionality that would be easy to implement. Can't keep files offline (desktop can). Desktop client is terrific.
Very useful, and I like it... keep doing good things guys
It's a good app
Doesn't support google shared drives (team drives).
It doesn't upload folder structure, why???
Best cross-platform encryption software

Very reliable, has potential but still lacks several trivial features for the price: file sorting, photo backup that works, folder upload, thumbnails (for pictures) , auto-lock after user defined amount of minutes, remember the last upload folder...

Thank you for the reply. After a day of WTHs, one of those that make no sense for those who deal with tech, I was able to finally download and install the app. As for the app itself, it works great, as advertised and as expected. Thank you for the good work and please excuse the lowered rating I gave earlier as it was a reflection of my frustration with google play.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback.
We aren't aware of any issue related to the download of the app from the store. Sorry for the circumstances but we can't do anything on this side...this is all in the hands of google. The only thing we could do is to initiate a refund and you repurchase the app, maybe it'll fix it.

content: Positive: + Folder names will be encrypted + I can use it for Windows, Linux, Android (im not sure for apple products) Negative: - Slow encryption and decryption - Pictures need long to load (in this app and on PC) Conclusion for me: In my opinion this app is only usable for documents, not for pictures. If you access your folder on your PC, all thumbnails need very long to load. If you have a lot of data to encrypt, it needs a long time.

Unfortunately I did not find this particularly useful. First of all, the sync is wrong; files that I created on desktop don't show up here. Also, it doesn't integrate into Android really at all. It would be one thing if it were a simple little open source beta, but it's not billed as that.

The desktop version of the app lets you add in various cloud providers, howver (unlike BoxCryptor) the android app only allows you to add in one cloud account for each type (one webdav, One Google Drive etc) so if you have more than one account, you are not able to view or open the files unless you log out of the account and connect to any additional accounts after. THe ability to add in numerous accounts (like Boxcryptor) would make this my go-to cloud encryption app and give a 5 star review!

Desktop version is good but the Android app is problematic. The app informed of "App is obsecured". Community forum says it is related to either blue filter, dark mode or apps that draw over another apps. Disable all those but it is still not working. 🤔
I love this app. It encrypts my files before upload to my Google drive.
replyContent: Should be fixed, please retest with the latest release, thanks :).

content: Needs a lot more basic features like: - View thumbnail/view type (card view, bigger list view) - Sort by (file type, date modified, etc)

Its nice app, but would be perfect to prevent (warning) opening documents with google app. They do copy direct to google cloud after opening (google sheet, docs etc). Privacy in that case makes no sense. Be aware of that. Feature request: image thumbals.
It's good to store some personal files like IDs but would be cool to see offline files support so you don't have to download them every time but they would still be encrypted or something
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback.
Starting in version 1.5.0 (which is available as beta) caching of downloaded files is implemented. If you want to join the beta and test this feature follow this link: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/org.cryptomator

content: I chose this because it asks for an upfront cost, rather than a costly subscription: well done! You got me. Works well. It connects to my cloud services easily, I can browse encryption images directly from the app. Perhaps the only thing I miss is fingerprint authentication, which I hope they will make available with the next release.
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback.
Fingerprint authentication can be activated in the settings, please follow the instructions in our docs: https://docs.cryptomator.org/en/latest/android/settings/#fingerprint

content: Very good to crypt files, files names and name directories. Open then view file is functionnal. Edit then save edited file is not always possible. In Excel for Android I found the solution. In a Cryptomator vault open Excel file with Excel app. Edit then instead of using "Save or Save as" use "Share" / "Save as an attachment" / "Workbook" then choose Cryptomator app. So to open, edit then save : open edit then share. This could work wit other apps ...
replyContent: "Have mot found a solution to that on github cryptomator forum, it's possible to open then edit save with Boxcryptor so Cryptomator could do it too !?" Here you can find more information about this topic: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/150#issuecomment-514401775

content: Grear app for wanting to keep your files using client side encryption and for cloud storage. Lacking are in-file search ability and no thumbnail image view meaning I have to make sure my filename means something.

Let's start with the good: Cryptomator desktop version is great. This App is not. Have to judge it for what it is - an expensive commercial app (if it was a low priced beta I would give it a good review). Only really useful to view or edit plain text files using the crude inbuilt editor. Anything else is no good. Text files sent to other text editors open blank. Files edited can't be sent back, and this opens massive security loopholes. No recent updates or fixes apparent.
Not great, no thumbnail views, hard to find what you want without preview for videos and images

Things simply too basic not to expect are unavailable in this app. e.g. integration with file managers, uploading more than a single file at a time, hiding the encryption & upload progress windows (they're in the way and you can only cancel them to do else), uploading a folder, etc. It's not fit to sell *yet.*

Great concept but app is new, needs key features, then will give 5 stars. I have a lot of confidential content on phone. Need option to MOVE to Cryptomator. The sole "Upload" option means that I have to spend double the time and look all thru my phone AGAIN to delete the confidential content that I just uploaded!! This wastes time and increases chance for error. PS: Paid apps shouldn't be bare-bones v1.0, so I'm applying a higher standard here. But also, great concept, keep working!

Bought this out of gratitude for making an open source client that can do device side encryption for many popular cloud providers. I don't even particularly need such a thing but I want to support such a project, taking on the overpriced, and less trustworthy competitors.
A solid open source and much lower cost alternative to Boxcryptor.

Great app, but it's missing a very essential feature! I have hundreds of pictures, and it's really hard to find a specific one by the name alone. It would be greatly useful if you could add "gallery view" mode in which we can see the thumbnails of the pictures in the folder!
Works as expected.
Earlier I got some difficulty to setup but it's great
Please add more cloud services (pCloud especially)
I use it to securely view PDFs that are stored on my PC. For that it's perfect. I evaluated other products, picked this one, and have been completely happy with my choice.

It works, but it lacks features compared to the desktop version. It is not possible to use multiple accounts from the same cloud provider (for example, a personal OneDrive account and a business one), and it's not possible to access files placed outside of vaults (for sharing with others), requiring another app or the web client to do this.
awesome experience. super simple. love it. please integrate with other FOSS apps

I don't know what the use-case is for this app, but it isn't to encrypt files in the cloud and edit them locally (in decrypted form). Firstly, whenever you unlock the vault and look away (for instance to use another app) the vault is locked. Unlocking it again requires you to type in a password. But much worse: whenever you unlock the vault and open a file in another app, say Word, that file is copied to the app. There is not trivial way to save it again from the app into the vault. You can save it, but then you have to hunt down wherever it's stored, and copy it back manually. For me, the app is useless.
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback!
There is a bug in the MS apps, that's why this files are read only...read more: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/150
If you increase the time the vault gets locked in Cryptomator settings, you have more time to switch between other apps. You can even disable the auto complete functionality.

content: Quie probably the best multi platform open source cloud encryption software in existence today. Cryptomator makes using encryption technology relatively easy. Desktop and android aps make this indispensable for protecting cloud stored files, and also on-device personal files. Performance is rock solid. Stability is excellent. The ability to encrypt and upload files to your cloud via the app is just outstanding. I cannot recommend this app strongly enough.
My app is crashing all the time. Please give me a refund
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback.
Can you please send us a email to support@cryptomator.org with the google account of the purchase? Then we can initiate a refund. Furthermore you could tell us in which context the app is crashing by providing a log file so we can solve the problem: https://tinyurl.com/y3xccy9c Thanks!

content: Great and useful tool.
Good app, but it need some improvements. I can search the folders but can't search files.
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback!
You can search for files and folders within a folder. If I understood you correctly, you want a search function across the entire vault? For this request, we have already a issue on Github https://tinyurl.com/y4g5j4je and will be implemented but will take some time.
Stay tuned!

content: Great work! The app is simple to use and works mostly as expected. To begin with, I was not aware that in order to edit .docx files, you had to download them, and upload them again after editing. Little annoying initially, but not a deal breaker. I since started using .txt files for most of my personal notes. Edit: I use Cryptomator on my Samsung S10 using a DeX station and an external keyboard. When I hit enter on the vault-unlock dialog, the cancel button gets focus without getting triggered.
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback.
To the problem with editing Microsoft files there is a description here: https://tinyurl.com/y4nd28kj
When I type my password into the dialog and press enter, the vault is getting unlocked. On your device the cancel button got triggered and dialog is closed?

content: Not being able to directly edit documents in the microsoft apps is a killer for me, but that should be solved soon according to the developers. Developers were unusually responsive and forthcoming, therefore 4 stars.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback!

content: No issues so far. Keep up the good work. Although the devs should make it so we can buy the app in Serbia.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback.
Will check why it's not possible to buy the app in Serbia, thanks for the hint!

Edit: Is available from now on in Serbia. Was a bug in the config, thanks again!

content: Seems to work well but there are some issues. Can't work with multiple accounts of Dropbox at the same time. Doesn't work with tresorit.
While I like the service, charging $10 for an app that makes your exported PDF unreadable is kind of steep...
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback and sorry to hear that.
We can not reproduce this problem. Could you please send us the log file and explain us in detail, what you have done to create a unreadable PDF. Thanks! :)

content: It's good but, folder upload is lacking. This is incredibly tedious to use when uploading files in multiple folders! Screen time-out causes uploads to stop while in use. This option should only be active when not doing anything. Is it possible to add a local sync folder, for the vault(s), that encrypt and updates locally saved files to the encrypted vault(s) on the fly / automatically? Would it be possible to stop other apps from deleting the vaults? I imagine this might not be possible?
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback.
Folder upload will be implemented https://tinyurl.com/y2j3b82c.
You can already disable in Cryptomator settings, that vaults get locked if screen timed out.
Syncing a local folder will be implemented too https://tinyurl.com/yxqtt8bz.
No, it is not possible to stop other programs from deleting vaults.
Please stay tuned.

content: This app is awesome. Highly recommended for encrypting your files.
Amazing application, this has changed the way i use cloud services
replyContent:
You mean something like that: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/95 ?

This feature is available since the 1.3.9

content: Great app!
Please add support for Team Drives..

I've been using cryptomator for quite a while on my desktop. This is 
definitely a gem! Having the ability to store data securely is the cloud is 
amazing!
App keeps crashing when I tap on "login to Google Drive: Edit, issue has been fixed and the app is working great.

content: This loses my files. it was working fine for 8 or 9 accessed to my files and the next time they were gone. I tried it again, re-added the files, and again, after several successful file accesses, the files disappeared again.

content: Updated: Dev is correct, but it should TELL you. Added 1 star. Original: Doesn't do anything at all. Just shows create vault screen, but that screen is completely dead, nothing responds to touches or swipes. 3 devices, Android 5.1 and 6.0.

This may be related to a blue light filter or similar apps. We rather recommend to use the app without a blue light filter because this is more secure but starting from version 1.3.0 the protection can be disabled in the settings. 

Since the 1.3.0 there is a dialog which tells you what is the problem see https://tinyurl.com/y6ejku4c

content: [2019-05-18 Yes, it works with the current version] Love the concept, HUGE advocate for the desktop version, however, it crashes when creating a vault for Google drive. Dropbox vault works. Also, UI is a bit confusing. update: it works now!

We have released a patch. This problem regarding Google Drive is solved with version 1.0.4.

content: Repeatedly crashed on Galaxy Note 9 Android 8.0.1. Had to uninstall. Please post in the version notes when it is fixed. Update 8 May 19: Your update seems to have fixed it. Thank you : )

content: Very nice functions! Current Android version 1.3.8 is very stable.  Love it!

content: It's price is steep, but I have no regrets. The app works great and feels very responsive. Now I have access to my encrypted data on my mobile and desktop, feels safe 😆
Glad the devs listen to user feedback
this app is fantastic. especially if you have a very large google drive ..like the education ones.

Well worth the money because it's offering secure encryption, works across different platforms, incorporates cloud storage and best of all, it's actively being developed and updates are regular. I was happy to support this project as I store my university documents in the cloud and wanted them to be secure.
had an issue and resolved within the hour

content: Love it. Everything easely encrypted

are there any plans to view images in the droid app like the desktop app? it makes it difficult to find the one you are looking for when you can only see the encrypted filename. when you open the wrong one and go back, it brings you back to the top of the list.

Not sure ... Should I rate it 5 stars, because it works as advertised. Or 1 star, because you can not save any files directly into the vault ("no moint point"). You have to save files outside the vault, then upload it with the app (even if the vault is on local storage) ... Knowing this, I still purchased the app. Hoping this will be added in the future :) And to support open source development.
Works well for what it does. some improvements needed: upload folders, create a virtual folder for access from other apps (like truecrypt volume mounting)
So far really good. It has access to most used cloud storage services and a fringerprint engine support.

it's pretty awesome still. not fully open source and not available outside google play store. please offer an alternative way to purchase your app. would gladly pay again simply cant use it on android devices without google's store
very easy to use and a must have if you have files that you store in cloud services

Great product. Even the little notetaking app for creating / editing files in the vault is well thought out. The only downside is there are fairly frequent messages when I'm not using the app that "Cryptomator stopped working", but it seems to be a spurious message.

Hi this is useful app but i have some doubts on file storing in mobile app. This is my situation. I need some clarifications.   I created a vault in my google drive in PC and put some text files, excel, word, images etc.  and i tried open them in android using this app and those are open as well. but my worry is, lets say if i open an excel sheet from vault which will open in excel app in phone and when i close vault, then the read only file still shows in excel and can be read and even can do save as in different name.  read only file shows the path like data>> user>> 0 etc.. because of this i think there is still a way to access using temp files. cant you delete those files via your app, lets say when i close that particular excel sheet in excel app. the same happen in word, power point and basically what ever the thirdparty app opener.  another thing for plain .txt files, is there any way to open them in different text editor without built in one? because built in one does not have features such as basics like search text etc.   I am waiting for your reply. you can contact me via email if needed. I gave reasonable rating because i believe in this and need to help you
Can't use vaults stored the SD-Card? Really?
replyContent: Using the "Local storage" when you choose the cloud service in the app, you should be able to store the vault on the SD-Card. Can you please specify you problem in more detail?

content: Good app but constant background crashes on s9+
replyContent: Should be fixed in the current version.

content: Just what I have been looking for.  This is the most seamless encryption cloud synchronization tools I have found yet.  The one thing new users should be mindful of is that the app must be open and unlocked to access the encrypted files.  Additionally, I wish the service offered it's own cloud decryption solution what worked in a browser to open encrypted files remotely.  Nevertheless, I don't see how that will be possible the way the service is currently engineered to work.  I think the mobile app is well worth the $5.00 (US) and I am planning on donating at least $10.00 (US) to the desktop version of the app.  Thanks.

I regularly use the desktop version of this app, which is great. However I am quite disappointed by the android version since it does not allow to access the decrypted files at a mount point in the local file system. I would understand this for cloud based container, but not for localy based container. This feature would greatly improve the android port of cryptomator
Works perfectly since 1 year
Garbage. For months the advertised Linux support had been broken, on the top Linux distros, and they've known it. If you're silly enough to use Windows, why use encryption anyway?
It's great
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback.
To navigate a folder up in the "move file or folder"-dialog, you have to press the back button of your phone.

content: Great app, would love to see native support for pCloud without needing WebDAV. Unable to view animated GIFs as well.

The app is great and even the PC version works really well. The only 
problem and made me delete the app was that I can't edit or creat files on 
the go in my android. Such a complicated process, developers should look 
into Boxcryptor app, they did it perfectly and is free on local account. I 
would rather use this app since is fully open source, however until the 
mobile app gets fixed I will stay away...

Fingerprint functionality is fantastic, but I really do wish image 
thumbnails were made available...I don't suppose there's a way for the app 
to decrypt just any image files in the current folder such that it's easy 
to find the picture you want?
replyContent:
As a first step, we implemented a filter function inside the folder, maybe that helps already: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/95#issuecomment-488421164

Thumbnails will follow in the future :)

content:
Cryptography is still a unexplored area by the most of users. This app 
makes it easier. Good job guys.

I can use this service to encrypt data on all my devices, Linux, Mac 
Android, etc. It is really helpful and user friendly. Love their business 
model, I much rather prefer to pay for an open source app (the desktop 
version is) than get a closed source one for free.
Nice app! Promising so far and works flawlessly for me.

Seems solid, but worth noting that the app doesn't enable connecting with 
more than one account for each available cloud storage service.
Works perfectly.

App with great concept, which -at first glance - does what it should do on 
Android and Windows. Big drawback is opening of text files. Those are 
opened with the built-in text editor which does not have a search function. 
Suggested workaround to share/export the text file is not useful since no 
normal text editor can be selected. Next to that: would be great if you 
could set an app PIN (I don't have a finger print reader on my tablet), 
since my vault password is extremely complex- for good reason.
replyContent:
At the moment, you can use the share functionality to open a txt file with an external editor. Created https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/108 with further information.

Protecting vaults with something like an master password will come soon: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/13

content: This app is simply amazing!
I'm sure it's great for encrypting documents etc but it's too slow for pictures and videos plus no thumbnails if you're trying to hide your amature porn hobby.
Like the app and plan to use it to access vaults stored in Google drive on my device. Would love it if the app worked in offline mode. Is this a planned feature?
replyContent: If you're using a local vault, offline mode is already available. If you think about storing some files for an offline usage using i.e. Google drive there is already an issue for that on github which tracks the current state: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/24

content: Best app for encrypted storage! But is it possible to make the listing of directories a little bit faster? Listing directory with 116 pdf files took 2 minutes from google drive (fast internet, top qualcomm CPU) (implement some directory caching, dynamic directory file list downloading, etc)!! Directories with 10-20 files lists ok, almost instantly...

Edit: Swipe to browse images implemented. No complaints now. Five stars.  Old review: Almost perfect, but I wonder if it would be possible to make the image browsing more user friendly. If an image is open in Boxcryptor, it automatically loads a few previous images and few images after the opened image file. This makes swiping through images faster and gives a better user experience. If that's not possible, I would atleast like to see swiping to browse previous/next image functionality.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback :)!

content: Love this app. Suggestion: upload in background so I don't have to wait.

I was so close to rating 5 stars, but when you open say a .docx file from the vault, it opens in Microsoft Word. Then after you lock the vault, you can still open the file in Microsoft Word app.... this is a serious floor. I don't mind read-only, but can you make it so the file is no longer accessible after the vault is closed. Or give like a preview of the file instead so that it doesn't download onto the device? Thanks
replyContent:
Thanks for your review!

Here are some more information about opening files in third party apps: https://goo.gl/ojrLMB
Opening more file types in the preview mode would be awesome, we will discuss that in more detail...

content: due to sandbox nature of android, other app wanna edit and save an unencrypted document is troublesome. ok for read.
replyContent: Store with Cryptomator opened and with a third party changed file back to the vault will be available soon, read mode: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/15#ref-issue-187329679

content: It's not perfect but I don't want to rate it lower than 5 because it's a great start. I hope you read this: please add some way to mass upload whole directory trees of files. I'd like to sync my photos into a Dropbox vault but I have more than 1000 photos so currently I have to upload them by selecting them in gallery apps in groups of a few hundred. Pretty please?
Good app. Meets expectation for downloading and reading encrypted vault. Also allows you to upload to your vault. This is the best cloud encryption app - and it's even open source as well! Love it
App stands still in the presence of blue light filters like Twilight.
replyContent:
We rather recommend to use the app without a blue light filter because this is more secure but starting from version 1.3.0 the protection can be disabled in the settings. Read more: https://goo.gl/U27uPP

Does this fix your problem?

content: Does not sync with Onedrive from mobile to desktop I was able to get the google drive to sync between mobile and desktop but not Onedrive please fix.
replyContent:
Do you still have this problem with the latest version?

If yes, could you provide us please a log file: https://community.cryptomator.org/t/how-do-i-enable-debug-mode-on-android/66

content: The best open source encryption app that's compatible with virtually all cloud syncing software. I've been using Cryptomator ever since its beta and is still getting better each update.
Image preview not working (One Drive).
Really the best app to combine encryption with existing clouds on the fly.
replyContent:
It should be possible to upload multiple files. When choosing a file to upload (through the default android UI) just longpress one of the files. The filechooser should switch into a multiselection mode then.

Thanks for the hint about canceling a download. We will address this in a future update. Export/download of folders is already on our list :)

content: Neat crypto app worth the nominal price the author asks. The desktop version is free. Cryptomator is a great alternative to Boxcryptor and Axcrypt.  Get it and support open source software.
The core of the app is open source and I like supporting the developers.  I've been using the app since it was in beta and love it.  I emailed support a question and got an instant response.
The best European, independent cloud encryption tool I've used. I chose for a European one because of privacy regulations in EU
Add a dark theme and allow us to customize the colors.
Everything works.  No complaints.

I've been using the beta for many months. This app was exactly what I was looking for, and I'm happy to be able to support the developers. I do wish both the Android and windows apps were a little faster, but hopefully that will come with time.
This app made my masterkey unusable on desktop as well. Poor support.
replyContent: You may contact us at support@cryptomator.org to get help. Please describe in detail what happened when using Cryptomator. We will assist you in finding a solution to your problem.

content: Thanks, good app. Is it possible to let us see icons of uploaded pictures? That would make it much much more user friendly and perfect for storing pics securely.
replyContent: Thumbnails is a feature we are thinking about. We may add it in a future version. Check out https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator-android/issues/41 for any details.

content: Great app but lacks multiple google drive support and also cannot use under a bluelight filter
replyContent:
Support for multiple accounts may follow in a later release. For now you can share the vault folders with the account you use in the app to get access.
We rather recommend to use the app without a blue light filter because this is more secure but up to now the protection can be disabled in the settings. Read more: https://goo.gl/U27uPP

content: Unreliable. I created an encrypted area but was then unable to unlock it. Luckily I only had test data in it. It took a long time to set up and now I have lost confidence in it.
replyContent:
You may contact us at support@cryptomator.org and provide some more details about the problem you experience. We will then look into it. Specific questions we have regarding this:
- What happens exactly if you try to unlock it? Are there any error messages?
- How did you put test data in it if you weren't able to unlock it?

content: Jetzt klappt auch das Erstellen eines Containers bei Google Drive. Danke für den schnellen Fix.
replyContent: Das Problem wurde mit Version 1.0.4 behoben.
